I200403240800
It doesn't happen with every text file, just one so far. I selected about 10 
lines and pressed DEL to delete them. The editor was replaced with an editor 
with an error message in it, and the .log showed the error below.

BTW, I just found out the file was marked read-only. First I tried unsharing 
the project and editing the file but it wouldn't let me type any changes. I 
exited Eclipse and started it again and still couldn't type any changes and 
that's when I discovered the file was read-only. I marked it read/write, 
reshared the project, and the problem went away.

I assume that the validateEdit caller, in this case the text editor, obtained 
a rule on the file and the CVS plug-in is trying to lock to project instead. 

Because of locak containement rules, we can't descope the lock in his case. 

We should patch this for M8, since it makes editing files impossible.

I have the fix for the CVS side but we require a modification from Core for 
this to work properly.

For this to work, we need Core to update the rule used for validate edit to be 
the parent of a file. This is a temporary fix until delegation to the 
repository provider is added.
Core has released the required fix for the 4p.m. build
